p.span: - Increase your productivity, customize your experience, and engage in information you care about.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id091f3c20-2762-4a74-be8c-a9928c8e7efc
inner col col24 first last id9eaab710-735e-4a8e-bf0c-e817ba32d044
inner col col24 first last idc3525066-b51b-467c-9152-4d9796f3c7a9

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

h2.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

td.p:
For over 70 years, CDC has been dedicated to protecting health and promoting quality of life through the prevention and control of disease, injury, and disability.
They are committed to programs that reduce the health and economic consequences of the leading causes of death and disability, thereby ensuring a long, productive, healthy life for all people.

p.a: Visit the CDC’s COVID-19 Web Page

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;

img.alt: Public Health - Idaho North Central District logo

td.style: width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

h2.a: Public Health - Idaho North Central District

td.p: Supporting public health preparedness by planning and preparing for emergency response to infectious disease outbreaks, public health threats, or bioterrorism events

p.a: Visit the North Central District’s COVID-19 Page

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.div:
Official resources for the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) including the Statewide
Stay-Home Order and additional guidance.

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p:
Gritman Medical Center is working quickly to respond to the rapidly evolving COVID-19 public health emergency and is implementing several changes at the hospital and our clinics to protect the health and safety of patients, staff and the community. Have questions about COVID-19 symptoms and testing?
Call the Gritman COVID-19 Hotline at 208-883-4109.

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p: The world is dealing with the outbreak of respiratory disease caused by a novel (new) coronavirus that was first detected in China and which has now been detected in almost 70 locations internationally, including in the United States. As the virus continues to spread, the University of Idaho is monitoring the situation and is committed to the health and safety of Vandals statewide.

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p: The City of Moscow’s Coronavirus (COVID-19) response is designed to follow and support State and Federal guidelines. The City of Moscow has taken several actions in the past weeks in support of those guidelines in an effort to mitigate and prevent the impacts of COVID-19 in our area.

p.a: City of Moscow’s Coronavirus (COVID-19) Resource Page

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p: MSD281 is working to balance the responsibility to provide your child with an education while ensuring everyone’s health and safety is considered. Their goal is to provide the best education possible during these uncharted times.

td.style: width: 28.407%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.5053%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p: With the cooperation and supervision of the County Commissioners the Department of Disaster Services is responsible for the development, maintenance and implementation of the Latah County Emergency Operations Plan.

td.style: text-align: center; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.div: The Moscow Chamber of Commerce is committed to serving our business community. Based on cautionary efforts to protect our employees and customers, the Moscow Chamber of Commerce business office will be closed starting Wednesday, March 18th. The Chamber staff is committed to supporting you and will remain connected remotely while the physical office location is closed (411 S Main Street). Their goal for the community is to continue to support local in ways that are safe and appropriate. The Chamber welcomes their clients and members to visit their website and official social media accounts for any news and updates regarding our services and operations.

div.a: Moscow Chamber of Commerce’s COVID-19 Page

td.style: width: 28.3333%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.579%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
td.p:
The City of Moscow offers this directory of community resources to aid anybody
looking for assistance from local organizations.

td.style: width: 28.3333%; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;
width: 71.579%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

h2.a: Idaho Commerce SBA Economic Injury Disaster Loan Information

td.p: The novel Coronavirus began shortly after the start of the new year and has caused disruptions in ordinary business functions and economic injury throughout the state. The event led to a State Disaster Declaration signed by Governor Brad Little on March 13th, 2020.

Idaho Commerce, in conjunction with the Governor’s Office, the SBA, and other State and Federal agencies, is working to provide resources and information to Idaho business and communities as they become available. Watch this page for updates and information as they become available.

td.style: width: 28.3333%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-align: center;
width: 71.579%; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

h2.a: Partnership for Economic Prosperity Survey & Website

td.p: The Partnership for Economic Prosperity (PEP), the Moscow Chamber of Commerce, Latah County, and the City of Moscow are concerned about you and your business as we are all navigating uncharted waters with COVID-19. In order to better understand your business needs while striving to help coordinate informational resources between local governments and our local business community, PEP developed the Regional Business Impact Impact Survey: COVID-19. PEP will use your survey responses to determine how to better share information, provide assistance, and direct you to resources if they are available. This survey should take 5-10 minutes to complete.

p.a: Regional Business Impact Impact Survey: COVID-19

td.style: background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; text-align: center; width: 28.3333%;
vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); width: 71.579%;
td.p: Updated benefits are offered to individuals whose unemployment is attributable to COVID-19. CAREs Act expanded the unemployment insurance program to include Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation (FPUC). This program adds an additional $600 to each claimant’s weekly payment.

p.a: Idaho Department of Labor Covid-19 Unemployment Insurance Page

td.style: vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); width: 28.3333%; text-align: center;

img.alt: Idaho Commission on the Arts Logo

td.style: background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); width: 71.579%;
td.div: As the COVID-19 pandemic evolves we want you to know that the Idaho Commission on the Arts is coordinating with government officials and closely monitoring the effect on our arts community. Many of you are up against uncharted challenges, facing interruptions in business and operations, and making difficult decisions about event and program postponements and cancellations.

div.a: COVID-19: Info & Resources for Artists/Arts Organizations

td.style: background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: middle; width: 28.3333%; text-align: center;
vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); width: 71.579%;
td.p: The City is working with businesses to designate select stalls as carry-out spaces so that you all can enjoy a little slice of comfort in these trying times, and help support our great food establishments. Any establishment interested in having a sign made available for curbside pick up for their business simply needs to call the City at 208-883-7097.

h4.a: City of Moscow Response to Governor Little Extended Stay-Home Order

div.div: City of Moscow announces adjustments to services, programs and facilities, and event postponements and cancellations in light of Idaho Governor Little’s Amended Statewide Stay-Home Order extending self-isolation requirements in Idaho to Apr. 30. Read on...

img.alt: &#34The Homecoming&#34 by Jennifer Corio & Dave Frei

h4.a: C & Main Public Art Project Update

div.div: The City of Moscow and the Moscow Arts Commission announce the design selected for the public art project at C & Main Streets. Artists Jennifer Corio & Dave Frei of Cobalt Designworks created the artwork entitled "The Homecoming," which was selected ... Read on...

h4.a: City Offers Signage for Curbside Pickup Orders

div.div: The City is working with businesses to designate select stalls as carry-out spaces so that you all can enjoy a little slice of comfort in these trying times... Read on...

h4.a: Clarification of Moscow Police Enforcement of Idaho Stay-at-Home Order

div.div: On Wednesday, March 25, Idaho Governor Brad Little issued a proclamation declaring an "extreme emergency" in the State as communities take measures to prevent the community spread of the COVID-19 virus... Read on...

h4.a: 2020 Burning Season in the City of Moscow

div.div: City of Moscow Fire Officials have announced the spring burning season is CANCELLED. Read on...

h4.a: Moscow Issues Additional Public Health Emergency Order and Closures

div.div: Mayor Bill Lambert has issued an additional Public Health Emergency Order No. 20-02 and additional City facility closures. Read on...
On Mar. 20, 2020, the Moscow City Council held an emergency meeting to consider an Ordinance providing the Mayor of Moscow authority to establish a Public Health Emergency Order. Read on...

h4.a: City of Moscow Emergency Meeting to Consider Emergency Order

div.div: Moscow City Council will hold an emergency meeting at 1 pm on Mar. 20, 2020, at Moscow City Hall. Read on...

h4.a: City of Moscow Closures and Suspended Services

div.div: The Moscow City Council approved Resolution 2020-05 at their regular meeting on Mar. 16 extending Mayor Lambert’s local emergency proclamation for Moscow, Idaho... Read on...
Moscow Mayor Bill Lambert declares local emergency proclamation for Moscow, Idaho. Read on...

The City of Moscow and the Moscow Arts Commission are pleased to announce that Artwalk 2020 registrations are now open. This year’s event is scheduled for Fri., Jun. 19 from 4-8 pm and includes artist receptions, musical performances, and ... Read on...

The "A" Street reconstruction between Peterson Drive and Home Street will include the complete reconstruction of the roadway, retaining walls, sidewalks, and replacement of underground utilities, as well as the reconstruction of part of Line Street. Read on...
Information about other past, present, and future construction projects is available on the "Construction Projects" web page. Read on...
